oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Capitol at Washington" stationery
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Correspondence from a soldier to his wife. He writes of the need for news from home. In the upper left hand corner is a depiction entitled "Capitol at Washington" printed by Reagles & Co. of New York. There is mention of Gen. Landers, a Col. Tyler and Bloomery Gap, Virginia, in this letter
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Historical Society Civil War Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Bloomery Gap (Va.)
Stationery; Letterheads
